result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce Richard Leszczynski Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bruce Richard Leszczynski Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Bruce Richard Leszczynski Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Scheduling Conference held.  At state's request, Court will sign a physical no contact order for upload.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DMT (9/16/1978)

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Bruce Richard Leszczynski in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly; both appear by video. Defendant Bruce Richard Leszczynski in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer A. Behnke. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,000.00 CASH.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Cooperate with mental health professionals and take all medication as prescribed. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Oral No Contact Order with D.M.T.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bruce Richard Leszczynski in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Bruce Richard Leszczynski in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report. Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bruce Richard Leszczynski in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Bruce Richard Leszczynski in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings, and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 35.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
